patterns: Information on Dedan Kimathi University of Technology
what is Dedan Kimathi University of Technology
responses: Dedan Kimathi University of Technology (DeKUT) is a premier 'Entrepreneurial University' located in Nyeri. It operates on the 'Triple Helix' model, linking government, academia, and industry.

patterns: What is the history of Dedan Kimathi University
How did Dedan Kimathi University start
Tell me about the origins of DeKUT
responses: The university started in 1972 as Kimathi Institute of Technology (KIT) through the 'Harambee' spirit.It was chartered as a full public university on December 14, 2012, by President Mwai Kibaki.It is named after Field Marshal Dedan Kimathi to honor the struggle for independence and liberation through education.

patterns: how far is dekut from nyeri
responses: Dedan Kimathi University of Technology is located about 6 km from Nyeri town along the Nyeri Mweiga highway.It sits on resource-rich grounds near Mt. Kenya, which supports its specialized mountaineering and tourism programs.

patterns: how can i contact the university
responses: You can reach Dedan Kimathi University of Technology (DeKUT) at: Main Campus contact and email:0713835965 email:marketing@dkut.ac.ke  and Nairobi CBD center contact and email : 0710127516 email directornairobi@dkut.ac.ke.For specific faculties, please ask for that department specifically.

patterns: can I come in on Saturday
what time does the office open
responses: The University generally operates Monday to Friday from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. Offices are closed on weekends and public holidays.
Our offices are open between 8:00 AM and 5:00 PM, Monday through Friday.
We are available weekdays from 8 am to 5 pm. We are closed on Saturdays and Sundays.
You can visit us during our standard operating hours: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM, Mon-Fri.

patterns: how much is the application fee
apply as a self sponsored student
responses: You can apply as a Government Sponsored (KUCCPS) or Self-Sponsored (SSP) student. Applications are digitized via the university portal.Application fees are KES 3,000 for PhD, KES 1,500 for Masters, and KES 1,000 for Undergraduate.How to Apply:Visit the portal, select your preferred program, and follow the instructions here:DeKUT Admission Portal
Fees vary by program and sponsorship type. Payments can be made via M-PESA (Business Number 222222) or direct bank deposits.Always use your registration number as the account reference.
The DeKUT Financial Aid Office (DeFAO) manages bursaries and a Work-Study program that allows students to work part-time within the university to earn money for their upkeep.

DeKUT has limited internal hostels (approx. 152 spaces). Most students reside in vetted external hostels like Tazama Place, Kirathimo, and Sunrise Hostel.Rents range from KES 2,500 to KES 10,000 per month.

DeKUT offers a dynamic student life with a wide range of sports and clubs. You can join outdoor teams (Football, Rugby, Hockey, Basketball), participate in indoor games (Badminton, Chess, Table Tennis), or join martial arts classes. The university also has numerous professional societies under DeKUTSO.

patterns: how do i use this bot
what can you help me with
responses: I can provide information about DeKUT programmes, admissions, contacts, fees, department leadership and more. Ask a specific question like 'What are the engineering programmes?' or 'Who is the dean of engineering?'.

patterns: i don't know what to ask
responses: If you're not sure where to start, try asking about admissions, programmes, or contact details. For example: 'What courses does the School of Engineering offer?'
I was created by Cheryl Achieng as part of a DeKUT final year project.

responses: Dedan Kimathi University (DeKUT) is organized into 6 Schools and 5 Institutes ,The  Schools are 1. School of Engineering 2. School of Computer Science & IT 3. School of Business Management & Economics 4. School of Nursing 5. School of Science 6. School of Graduate Studies and Institutes are 1. Institute of Food Bioresources Technology (IFBT) 2. Institute of Geomatics, GIS & Remote Sensing (IGGReS) 3. Institute of Tourism & Hospitality Management (ITHoM) 4. Geothermal Energy Training & Research Institute (GeTRI) 5. Institute of Technical & Professional Studies (ITPS - for Diplomas)

DeKUT offers a wide range of Undergraduate, Postgraduate, and Diploma programmes across varying fields.

patterns: who is the dean of engineering
who leads the school of engineering
who is the head of civil engineering
structure of the school of engineering
responses: The School of Engineering is led by Dean Dr. Njenga Mburu. Departments include Chemical Engineering (HoD Dr. Kimutai Tewo), Technology Education (HoD Dr. Addero Wilson Ogot), Civil Engineering (HoD Dr. Kevin Achieng), Electrical & Electronic Engineering (HoD Dr. Edwell Tafara Mharakurwa), Mechatronic Engineering (HoD Dr. Titus Murwa Mulembo), Mechanical Engineering (HoD Dr. Mburu Ngugi).

Undergraduate programmes in the School of Engineering include: BSc Electrical & Electronic Engineering, BSc Telecommunication & Information Engineering, BSc Mechatronic Engineering, BSc Mechanical Engineering, BSc Chemical Engineering, BSc Civil Engineering, BEd Technology (Electrical & Electronic), BEd Technology (Mechanical) and BEd Technology (Civil).

Postgraduate programmes include M.Sc. in Advanced Manufacturing & Automation Engineering, Machine Tools Design & Manufacturing, Industrial Engineering & Management, Telecommunication Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Civil Engineering, and a PhD in Mechanical Engineering. Requirements typically include a relevant BSc with an upper second-class honours or equivalent and, in some cases, relevant work experience.

patterns: can I do engineering with C plain
what subjects do I need for engineering
responses: Minimum entry for most engineering undergraduate programmes is a KCSE mean grade of C+ with passes in Physics, Chemistry, English and Kiswahili (or equivalent). Specific programmes may have additional subject requirements; please specify the programme for precise entry requirements.
Generally, engineering degree programmes require a KCSE mean grade of C+ and good performance in the relevant science subjects. Contact admissions for programme-specific criteria.

patterns: who is the dean of computer science
who is the dean of computer science
responses: The School of Computer Science & Information Technology is led by Dean Dr. George Musumba with Dr. Kinyua Gikunda as a key departmental lead. The school includes programmes in computer science, information technology and business information technology.

patterns: what computer science programmes do you offer
what computer science programmes do you offer
responses: Undergraduate programmes include: BSc Computer Science, BSc Information Technology, and BSc Business Information Technology. Entry requirements vary; BSc Computer Science typically requires a C+ in Mathematics and a C+ in Physical Sciences or an equivalent combination of qualifications.
The school offers master's degrees in Computer Science, Cybersecurity and Data Science, as well as PhD opportunities for qualified candidates with a relevant master's degree.

patterns: can I do computer science with C plain in math
what subjects are needed for computer science
responses: Minimum entry varies by programme. Most computer science and IT courses require a KCSE mean grade of C+ and a C plain in Mathematics and English/Kiswahili. BSc Computer Science may require a higher performance in Mathematics and Physical Sciences.

patterns: who is the dean of science
who is the dean of science
responses: The School of Science is led by Dean Dr. Antony Ngunyi. Departments include Chemistry (HoD Dr. Paul Tanui), Mathematics & Physical Sciences (HoD Dr. Reuben Ndungâ€™u), and Statistics & Actuarial Science (HoD Dr. Cyprian Omari).

patterns: what courses are offered in school of science
responses: The school offers a variety of science degrees such as Actuarial Science, Industrial Chemistry, Leather Technology, Polymer Chemistry, Medical Physics and Mathematics & Modeling Processes.

patterns: postgraduate courses in school of science
responses: Postgraduate programmes include MSc in Leather Technology, MSc in Chemistry, MSc in Industrial Biochemistry, MSc in Laser & Photonic Technology, MSc in Industrial Mathematics, and a PhD in Chemistry. Admission usually requires a relevant bachelor's degree with strong academic performance.

patterns: how to join school of science
how to join school of science
can I do science with C plain
responses: Most science degree programmes require a KCSE mean grade of C+ with strong performance in Mathematics, English/Kiswahili and relevant science subjects. Specific requirements vary by programme.

patterns: who is the dean of business
who is the dean of business
responses: The School of Business, Management & Economics is led by Dean Dr. Anne Sang. The school oversees undergraduate, diploma and postgraduate programmes in business-related disciplines.
Business undergraduate options include Commerce, Business Administration and Purchasing & Supplies Management, plus diploma pathways for progression.

Postgraduate programmes include: MBA, MSc Business Analytics, MSc Supply Chain Management, MSc Project Management, MSc Economics, MSc Innovation & Entrepreneurship Management, Postgraduate Diploma in Project Management, and PhD programmes in Business Administration & Management and Operations & Supply Chain Management.

patterns: can I do commerce with C- in math
entry grade for purchasing and supplies
do I need physics for business
responses: Degree programmes generally require a KCSE mean grade of C+ with good performance in Mathematics and English/Kiswahili, or a recognized KNEC diploma. Master's and PhD requirements vary based on academic background and experience.

patterns: who is the dean of nursing
who is the dean of nursing
who is in charge of nursing school
responses: The School of Nursing is led by Dean Dr. Florence Mbuthia.

patterns: Tell me about the nursing course
Does DeKUT have a nursing school?
responses: The School of Nursing offers: Bachelor of Science in Nursing (Direct Entry) and Bachelor of Science in Nursing (Upgrading) for registered nurses. Requirements differ depending on the track.

patterns: What are the requirements for nursing?
Do I qualify for BSc Nursing?
What subjects do I need for nursing?
responses: Direct-entry BSc Nursing requires a KCSE mean grade of C+ with a C+ in Biology, English/Kiswahili, Mathematics/Physics and Chemistry. The upgrading programme requires KRCHN or KRN/KRM/PH, two years of experience and valid NCK licensing.

patterns: who is the dean of graduate school
Who is the Dean of the graduate school?
Who heads the post graduate school?
Who is in charge of masters and PhD programs?
Name of the graduate school dean
responses: The School of Graduate Studies & Research is led by Dean Dr. Douglas Onyancha.

patterns: who is the director of criminology?
what are the requirements for security management?
responses: The Institute of Criminology, Forensics and Security Studies is led by Director Mr. Dennis Miano. It offers BSc Criminology & Security Management and MSc Forensics & Security Management. Programmes align with CUE regulations and focus on applied criminology and corporate forensic management.

patterns: what courses are in the geomatics institute?
BSc Geospatial Information Science & Remote Sensing
BSc Geospatial Information Science & Remote Sensing
responses: The Institute of Geomatics, GIS & Remote Sensing (IGGReS),  offers BSc Geomatics Engineering & GIS, and BSc Geospatial Information Science & Remote Sensing. It also offers postgraduate programmes including MSc GIS & Remote Sensing and a PhD in Geomatics.

patterns: what grade do I need for geomatics engineering?
entry grade for GIS and remote sensing
can I join with a diploma in land surveying?
responses: KCSE applicants need a C+ in Mathematics and at least a C+ in two subjects such as Physics, Chemistry, Geography, Biology or Physical Sciences. Diploma applicants require a credit in a relevant KNEC diploma such as land surveying or geomatics.

patterns: who is the director of the tourism institute?
responses: The Institute of Tourism and Hospitality Management (IToHM), led by Director Dr. Peninah W. Chege, offers programmes in sustainable tourism and hospitality. The institute focuses on tourism operations, hospitality skills, wildlife management and sustainable tourism practices.

patterns: what courses are offered at IToHM?
does dekut offer short courses in tourism?
responses: IToHM offers: BSc Sustainable Tourism & Hospitality Management, Diploma in Sustainable Tourism & Hospitality Management, Certificate in Institutional Accommodation & Catering Operations, and several short courses including Mountaineering & Outdoor Expeditions Guiding.

patterns: what grade do I need for tourism?
can I join with a C minus?
responses: For BSc Sustainable Tourism & Hospitality Management, applicants need a C+ in KCSE or a relevant diploma. Diploma entry requires a C- with relevant subjects. Certificate courses require a minimum of D or D- depending on specialization.

patterns: who is the director of ifbt?
who leads the food science institute?
administration of the food science institute
responses: The Institute of Food & Bioresources Technology (IFBT), led by Director Dr. Richard Koskei.

patterns: what courses are offered at IFBT?
responses: Programmes include: BSc Food Science & Technology, BSc Nutrition & Dietetics, Diploma in Coffee Technology & Cupping, Certificate in Coffee Technology, MSc Food Science & Technology, and PhD in Food Science & Technology.

patterns: what grade do I need for food science?
can I join ifbt with a C minus?
certificate in coffee technology entry grade
what are the qualifications for ifbt
do I qualify for a degree in food science
minimum grade for diploma in nutrition
is chemistry mandatory for food science?
responses: Here are the general entry requirements for IFBT programmes it requires a KCSE mean grade of C+ with strong passes in Chemistry, Biology and Mathematics/Physics. Diplomas require at least a C- with relevant science subjects. Certificates require D+ or D depending on the course.

patterns: does dekut have a tvet section
who is the director of itps
responses: The Institute of Technical & Professional Studies (ITPS), led by Director Dr. Erastus Karoki, offers diplomas, certificates and professional courses across business, engineering, tourism, IT, fashion, building technology, welding and more.

patterns: does itps offer diploma in IT
responses: ITPS offers diplomas in: Business Admin, Purchasing & Supplies Management, Information Technology, Security Management, Coffee Technology & Cupping, Food Science Technology, Tourism & Hospitality, Electrical & Electronics Engineering (Power), Fashion Design, Furniture Technology, Building Technology, Metal Work & Welding.

Certificate programmes include: Electrical & Electronics Engineering, Fashion Design, Furniture Technology, Building Technology, Welding & Design, German Language, IT, Coffee Technology, and Mountaineering & Outdoor Expeditions Guiding.
Professional courses include APS-K, CPSP-K, ATD Level I, Siemens Mechatronic Systems Certification (SMSCP Level 1), and advanced training in procurement and accounting.

patterns: who is the director of getri
responses: The Geothermal Training & Research Institute (GeTRI), led by Director Dr. Patrick Chege Kariuki, offers advanced training in geothermal energy exploration, drilling, geoscience analysis and geothermal engineering.
Programmes include: MSc Geothermal Energy Technology, Postgraduate Diploma in Geothermal Energy, and BSc Geology. These programmes cover earth sciences, engineering and geothermal exploration.

patterns: what grade do I need for bsc geology
qualifications for masters in geothermal energy
can I do msc geothermal with a second class lower
is work experience required for msc geothermal
responses: Here are the specific entry requirements for GeTRI programs,MSc Geothermal Energy Technology requirements include a relevant BSc in geology with at least Second Class Upper or Second Class Lower with experience. BSc Geology requires a C+ in KCSE with strong grades in Mathematics and two science subjects.

patterns: tell me about institute of general studies
tell me about institute of general studies
who is the director of general studies
responses: The Institute of General Studies, led by Director Prof. Theuri Matthew Mwangi, oversees university-wide common units such as Communication Skills, Business English, Philosophy, Critical Thinking, Development Studies and Gender & Development.
